page.title: 02NEW ABBEY - ECOLOGY
page.content: Loch Kindar, which is about a mile long and half a mile wide, lies at the foot of Criffel. It is 40 feet deep in places but the water-level has been reduced since thousands of trees were planted on the hillside some forty years ago. Since 1958 the loch has been owned by Loch Kindar Angling Club. The members keep the boats and boathouse in good condition, and restock the loch regularly with rainbow trout and brown trout. There is an island with a causeway leading to it from the east shore. The ruins on the island are believed to be that of a church but no one is sure. The Angling Club has cleared the isle of weeds and planted shrubs, azaleas and rhododendrons, which make a splash of colour in the springtime.
